description:
This place is a solid local chain for fresh salads and sandwiches. I tried the blackened snapper sandwich and came back again for the pesto chicken sandwich and cajun gumbo.

Everything here is fresh, tasty, and good size portions. It gets a bit busy at peak meal hours but they have quick turn around time so its not bad. The pesto chicken had a lot of grilled chicken breast and a light pesto flavor thats not overpowering and the snapper was super tender and juicy but subsequently also messy. 

Service here is friendly tho they did forget my soup spoon. Look forward to coming back and trying more of the menu.
author: Sean G.

description:
Small corner spot with some seating and minimal decor. I walked by on the way for dinner at a nearby restaurant, and decided to give it a try the following morning, based on the positive Yelp reviews.

I ordered "#2 bacon, scrambled eggs, herbs, cheese and tomato" on a sesame bagel. Unfortunately, despite the great list of ingredients, the final product was not tasty.

Service was welcoming and friendly.
author: Tom S.

description:
The sandwiches are pretty good - I've had the chicken parm, eggplant parm and caprese. 

The salads are nothing special. Fine but not outstanding. 

I've only ever ordered take away as there are only a couple of seats inside. 

The people who work there are super friendly!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I wouldn't give any stars if I could. 

Worst customer service EVER! 

My co-worker and I went here yesterday and she ordered the Chicken Chipotle Salad but when we got back to the office, there was no chicken in her salad at all. She calls and AJ, the manager, picks up and offers to comp her for the missing chicken. 

So we go back the next day and AJ did not fulfill his word. He wanted to charge her for a new salad minus how much the chicken would have cost ($2.95) instead of just comping her a salad altogether. Remember it's their initial mistake, not hers. 

Lesson to restaurant managers: To comp ONE salad for ONE customer who will probably come back to your place is WORTH the correction and shows GOOD customer service. 

We're not going back there and will likely tell other co-workers.
author: Minnie M.

description:
Go-to lunch spot for a quick bite. Fast service. Friendly staff. Reasonably priced. 

My favorites are the Cobb salad and the Spicy Cajun Chicken protein bowl. 

The line may look long but they move quick!
author: Barron C.

description:
A small cafe on the corner of Bush and Kearney.  We came here for a breakfast and really enjoyed our food.  

I had the BEST smoked salmon bagel sandwich ever.  The prices are decent considering where we are and the service is good too.
author: Jesse L.

description:
I foolishly thought this was a different restaurant that I was looking for and didn't realize it until we got our food. It ended up pretty good anyways. I should have gotten a sandwich from there. They cut their meat on a deli slicer and the sandwiches looked delicious. 

My girlfriend and I ordered salads and they were pretty good. I also got their chicken noodle soup and it was not very good. It wasn't warm and was sub par in quality and taste. The greens were fresh and I enjoyed the portion sized but wasn't anything special. The seating inside was pretty cramped. I think most places are like this in San Francisco. The people working there were very nice and polite. The whole restaurant seemed like a business man's lunch time go-to. They had a lot of variety for lunch.
author: Nico M.

description:
Fantastic little downtown cafe. The bagels were awesome - toasted to perfection and loaded with cream cheese. 

Sit at the window bar stools and people watch in the morning.
author: Tim D.

description:
Reminiscent of your standard corner deli. This spot is small with minimal seating and a big board with sandwich/breakfast options. Wednesday early morning and nobody inside, so was first in line to order.

In the mood for something substantial - ordered an onion bagel with turkey, tomato, avocado, and cream cheese ($7) to go along with a large latte ($3). Bagel is tightly packed and overflowing with ingredients. Turkey and cream cheese was a nice balance, though I felt the avocado was overkill (texture wise). Coffee didn't need any sugar and was strong enough to last we all day.

Price point here is solid and the food comes out quickly. Perfect place for a quick fix.
author: Shaji K.

description: Great food this morning! It was our first place for food on our vacation from the UK and the food was great! I got the bacon scrambled and cheese on an English muffin and Rachel got the Avocado on toast.... highly recommended! We will be back.
author: William T.

description: This was right next to the hotel we stayed and I tried Apicy Thai chicken sandwich. Oooh, it was AMAZING! They use non-gmo / organic ingredients only.  I'm gonna try one new sandwich for the next few days till I leave
author: Durga A.

description:
Working Girls' Cafe seems to be a popular breakfast and lunch spot in SoMA and I can understand why -- because their breakfast sandwiches are amazeballs!

In addition to breakfast sandwiches and bagels, they also serve specialty lunch and deli sandwiches, soups, salads and protein bowls. I ordered the #2 with turkey on a jalapeno bagel. The sandwich was huge, but overall it was delicious because the bagel was toasted perfectly and they were very generous on the cheese!

Staff was friendly and the line moved by quickly. The cafe itself is small and has about 10 seats, both inside and outside.
author: Annie P.

description: Mediocre food. And the name "working girls cafe" is pretty misleading if you don't have WiFi...
author: Sarah M.

description: Better option than Starbucks! Reasonable prices and good breakfast deli. Will return for a quick morning bite on the go. Staff was friendly and place is clean.
author: Maricruz L.

description:
3.75- friendly staff, tasty food in this deli-like spot

Inside only sits a handful of people- it got crowded when a group of 6 crowded some tables behind us as we were leaving.  Note that there is no bathroom.

Staff seemed very friendly; we started chit-chatting about our weekend schedules while waiting for the food (which took 5 min or so).

I ordered the Baby Spinach Salad ($9.95) with salmon on top (+$3.50)- it was a LOT of spinach and not as much craisins / mushrooms / walnuts / everything else, but the dressing was flavorful enough that I didn't mind as much.  The salmon was served warm on top of the salad (which I liked) with a lemon-butter sauce and some capers- certainly helped warm me up on a chilly day.  All salads include a slice of baguette; kinda wish it were toasted or something because it was rather plain.

Overall, a decent place to quickly grab a sandwich/ salad at a reasonable price.  Nothing too spectacular but satisfied enough that I would come again; plus no negatives so far that would deter me from visiting again.
author: Audrey H.

description:
My hotel suggested I take a walk over to Working Girls' Cafe as I wanted a great salad to take back to my room.  Got here around 300 PM ish.  Cute place, friendly folks working here.

Ordered a Cobb salad to go.  Also picked up a fruit salad.  With a bottle of sparkling water the price was under $20.  Fair price for San Francisco.  Service was very fast as they had my Cobb salad prepared in less than 2 minutes.

My salad had fresh ingredients; however, overall was very mediocre.  I could have used more meat, cheese and avocado.  I would never order this again.  My fruit salad was a disaster.  The honeydew and cantaloupe (which combined were 80% of the fruit salad) were not ripe, hard and tasteless.

I may try this place again; however, will be moire careful about what I choose to order.
author: Jay A.

description:
This is one of my favorite 'simple' sandwich shops in FiDi to grab a quick bite for lunch.  There are fancy sandwich spots nearby that charge an arm and a leg for organic, specialty ingredients (e.g. steak with goat cheese), but sometimes you want something basic, yet high quality.  If that's what you're after, look no further.  Favorite go-to sandwiches are the roast beef and cheddar, and the chicken parmesan. 

I've tried most combinations of a make your own sandwich, about half of the specialty sandwiches, as well as the quinoa bowl and they're all great.  The deli meat is high quality and the bread (especially the toasted seeded roll) is fantastic.  My only gripe is that they've raised their prices several times over the past year without improving their sandwiches, which puts them very close to the higher priced spots, yet lacking in the specialty ingredients those spots offer.  They did recently refinish the interior, though I didn't have any gripes about that to begin with.  

If you're looking for a quick and 'simple' sandwich, this is your spot.
author: Tom G.

description:
There's plenty of options here and it's never as crowded at Mixt. 
I got the kale and quinoa salad with added chicken. They didn't drench the salad with too much dressing which was great.  My coworker got the cajun chicken sandwich and it looked amazing!  I definitely need to go back and try their sandwiches. 

The staff is super friendly and sweet. They asked about my weekend and asked if I needed recommendations since I was staring at the menu for a while :)
author: Annie N.

description: A nice guy greeted us at the door, and was super accommodating. Amazing food and not expensive. Enjoy
author: Shay P.

description: Still 5 stars - just wanted to add that I love you for taking Apple Pay because I forget my wallet once out of every 5 times I come here.  You da best!
author: Jessica F.

description:
We arrived around 10:30am on NYE, and most tables were free, but not long later, maybe the start of lunch time customers, it started filling up.
 
- Pesto chicken focaccia: I expected the bread to be a bit softer than it was, but it was still good. Chicken was warm with a generous portion of pesto heaped on both sides. 
- Number 2 - ham, egg, cheese, tomato on a French baguette (because they ran out of savoury bagels and croissants haha). Warm, gooey, delicious.
- soup of the day: it felt a bit like a more watery chicken gumbo. Not my favourite, but came with more French baguette, which was good.

They had a bunch of different sandwich options (and by a bunch I mean like probably 20 lol), so I'd definitely like to come back and give some other flavours a try! Great value for some great food for sure.
author: Joanna C.

description:
Took the Mansarin Chicken Salad -  very rich, very fresh and not too costy.
Highly recommended for a healthy lunch. They also have great Protein Bowls that my friend took!
author: Or K.

description:
Working Girls' Cafe is a great spot for grab and go breakfast or lunch. In case you are concerned, boys are also welcome. 

This spot is located close to Yelp HQ and I always wandered by not thinking much of it. When a group of coworkers and I were on the hunt for a simple lunch, reviews pointed us here! The menu offers an extensive variety of sandwiches and some salad. I jumped back in forth between what I thought I wanted, "The blackened red snapper, NO, the California Melt, NO, maybe I should get a salad..." In a last minute frenzy, I ended up with the BBQ Chicken Breast sandwich with cheddar, BBQ sauce, lettuce, and tomato, hold the red onion and mayo. Ain't no one need that. The sandwich was filling and delicious. I got a bag of chips on the side because #yolo. I couldn't finish it all, but boy did I try. 

A few days later, I ended up returning for a breakfast bagel sandwich of smoked salmon, cream cheese, tomato, capers (again, hold the red onion) on an everything bagel. It had way too much cream cheese on it for my liking but I cleaned it right up.

Food is served quickly and packaged up great for taking to the office or wherever you may be headed. Definitely happy I decided to give Working Girls' Cafe a try. I'll certainly be back to make my way through the menu soon!
author: Cassie P.

description:
Stopped here for a quick breakfast sandwich after my workout. It's a pretty standard deli where you can get both hot and cold sandwiches with an array of drinks. 

I ordered an egg white, cheese, and turkey sandwich on whole wheat with tomato. It was not bad at all, but there could have been more egg and they only put a singular slice of tomato on the sandwich.

Nothing extraordinary, but it gets the job done.
author: Kyle S.

description: I ordered a chicken caesar to-go and instead of caesar dressing they smothered my salad with sweet Italian dressing. Very strange. My receipt says chicken caesar and the guy called my name and said "chicken caesar to-go". Probably won't be coming back....although I give them 2 stars because their prices are considerably lower than other salad places like Mixt greens.
author: Daniel F.

description: Came across this place while walking around, looking for something to eat. Nice, clean environment with an inside seating area. I ordered the Mandarin chicken bowl, which was delicious! The mix of kale and quinoa was great. Overall, I felt like the flavor of the dressing went well with the salad. I felt very healthy, but it filled me up! Would recommend trying
author: Shelly N.

description: The food is great here. So many sandwich and salad options to choose from. The staff is super-friendly! Will definitely be going back.
author: Neha S.

description:
Great food and great staff and ownership. They got a large and conplicated work lunch order correct and set aside a counter for me to check all the items and helped me with names. 

Again, super friendly and helpful. There's a reason it's always busy. Check it out!
author: Zac Z.

description:
Had a great breakfast with my friend here! The owner/staff were really friendly. The place is clean and bright, the menu selection is really really good--they've got all kinds of bagels and salads and I can't remember what else...sandwiches I think, because I know there were potato chips for sale too and those usually come with sandwiches right? 
Anyway yeah, it wasn't too busy when we were there plus it was raining too so we dined in (wow what a fancy phrase, dined in) and we had the kale salad and salmon+lox bagel. Let me tell you, both of us love our salads but their serving size was so generous we only got through 3/4 of it! Two veggie lovers couldn't finish a kale salad!
If you're still reading, I hope this convinces you to go to the Working Girl's Cafe when you're in the area hungering for a nice healthy meal. I'm just rambling to meet the word count haha but I mean what I wrote!
author: Natalie N.

description:
Really expensive and food is only ok for what you're paying for. I got the California Melt (sandwich with cheese, turkey, avocado, tomato, bacon) with a bottle of water, and although the portion was very large, it was $13 and not tasty enough to justify the price. It wasn't bad, but I could have made it at home since it wasn't anything very special. 

I'd recommend coming to this deli (cafe is kind of a misnomer even though they have coffee) if you're just here for convenience and need a quick bite to eat. I'm sure there are other better options on Kearny street though. They also don't have wifi, which was something I assumed they'd have because they market themselves as a cafe.
author: Michele W.

description:
SAVED FROM THE "HANGRY" BEAST....

Sunday... unbeknown to my friend and I at the time.... involves San Francisco pretty much shutting down food wise from around 2/3 o'clock.... so after a long morning / early afternoon on the tour bus, when hunger strikes... and you can't seem to get fed within 2 miles... anger sets in... meaning both of us being serious HANGRY (hungry/angry). 

En route back to the hotel, we clocked this place actually open and discovered a little gem in the process. 

Greeted by a smile, we ordered a fresh salmon cheese bagel and an avocado and turkey sandwich on rye bread. Both delicious. Filled a hole. And left a craving to return. Guy who served us even gave us a good ol friendly wave the following day as we passed the cafe on our way on another adventure. 

Great service. Cheap and cheerful. Definitely better than it looks. Thanks guys!
author: Danielle L.

description: The pesto chicken sandwich we got here was not good at all. People working there were great though, however the sun-dried tomatoes and pesto is an unpalatable combination.
author: Priyanka S.

description: I LOVE this cafe. It's been around for years, and they consistently make delicious, fresh and nutritious food. They are also very nice. Their app also works great! And for downtown SF where most places charge $14 bucks minimum for a sandwich, getting a specialty sandwich like my fav- their filet of salmon - for $11.25 is quite reasonable. Thanks, Working Girls, for staying solid all these years!
author: Amy C.

description:
Pretty tasty and open on weekends! $10.99 for a massive kale quinoa salad, think Mixt but a tad less amazing.

The space is small, seats roughly 10. Service is friendly.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Decided to come back and try one of their sandwiches before I fully said goodbye to this place. 

I ordered the lemon garlic chicken sandwich ($10), which comes with mayo, artichoke, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, served on a Rosemary bread.

What I got was a dry piece of flavorless chicken, with a small piece of artichoke and the essentials (tomato, onion, lettuce) on bread with a spec of rosemary... 

My coworker and I ended up going back to the office to add salt and sriracha.... To get SOME sort of flavor.
author: Carrie L.

description: The soup was pretty good, but the salad is soggy with dressing. I still give four for a ​warm welcome.
author: John G.

description: I went to get a sandwich this morning at 8:15am shown on my receipt and I ordered a smoked turkey on soft roll (without seeds), mustard, pickles and that's it. I paid $9.95 for this sandwich. While I was waiting I looked at my receipt and it showed roast turkey. I asked the counter person I ordered smoked turkey. He said ok, and ask the lady who was making the sandwiches in Spanish is the meat smoked turkey she looked at me and responded back in Spanish. The guy said oh she said she made it with smoked turkey. I was in a rush so I took the sandwich without looking. Now at lunch time I unwrap the sandwich and it is roast turkey. So the lady making the sandwich didn't care enough to remake the sandwich since the counter guy rang it up wrong. I wasted $9.95 of my money because they probably wanted to save money and hope I didn't know the difference between DRY very Dry roast turkey and smoked turkey. Never will return to this place again. I called and tried to speak to someone and they kept passing it to different people I don't think they spoke English which makes NO Sense. Finally someone who could speak English told me can I bring the sandwich back and he would make another one. It's lunch time I'm in the financial district, Working girl is about a ten minute walk from my job. No I will starve today because I do not have the time to go back, I'm throwing this dry sandwich away. What they should of said to have me return and show how sorry they were is, "On Monday please come back and we will make you a sandwich for free." Whoever is the recruiter for this place you need better staff, and anyone working period and answering the phone should speak English. Your customers speak English and you want our money, right?
author: Liyah S.

description: Walked by here a few times while exploring the city. We decided to come on in for a quick late breakfast bite one mid morning. Not too busy and they had healthy options. Salads, sandwiches, juices bagels etc. We just got a egg sandwich with an extra egg. It was a good amount which was nice and you can tell the egg wasn't microwaved! It was piping hot, I think they folded it a few times and tucked into a nice wheat bread with uncooked bacon. Yes, you know that limpy fatty bacon? That was what we got. I don't eat bacon anyways so I just pulled it out. It came with a blend of swiss and cheddar. A perfect sandwich to share. Chips and drinks in a cooler if you want to grab something to go.
author: Valerie M.

description: Excellent food  And very healthy. I ended up going back here for lunch and they gave me a water for free bc I forgot mine at my event.
author: Tina K.

description:
So they have vanilla lattes and non fat milk (hard to come by in this city without going to Starbucks) but I ordered it extra hot and it was delivered less than luke warm and tasted like day old Denny's coffee with not hot frothed milk on top.

Wouldn't come again.
author: Lucky S.

description: I love this place. Their smoked salmon sandwich is excellent. The owners and staff are very friendly. Great location.
author: Margo C.

description: I've visited all the Working Girls' Cafes, but this is a favorite since it's open on weekends. They have a vast menu of attractive salads and sandwiches, but I usually order a bagel with cream cheese when I'm on my way to work. This time I tried the pumpernickel bagel which was excellent. The sun dried tomato cream cheese was also great. Due to speedy and friendly service, I'll return to Working Girls' Cafe to try their other offerings. It's great to find healthy delicious food in the FiDi on a Sunday!
author: Carol W.

description:
Sandos on par with Yike's Yace and You's Yafe.
Except with actually self-descriptive names.
Funny how "for here" orders are still wrapped to-go.
And how it's Working *Girls* but there are dudes.
San Francisco is a leader in gender acceptance.
author: Dan B.

description:
I wanted a healthy option while in SF and I found it!
I got the roasted beet salad which had goat cheese, pear, and walnuts. Loved the flavor combination. I also added chicken which was good! Salad comes with bread too! You can make modifications too which is awesome!
author: Connie L.

description:
Solid lunch option in the FiDi.  Prices are average for the area.  I've only tried the sandwiches.  They're fast, made to order, fresh and filling.  

I had the Mexicali today.  The bread was warm and toasty and the lettuce was compactly stacked, belching out a loud crunch with each bite.  Personally, I thought it was a little bland but that's easily overcome by adding Sriracha.  Also, "avocado" actually means a thin layer of avocado schmear, not slices; unfortunately, I don't have condiments at my desk to Macgyver this issue.
author: Amy J.

description: I popped in for a muffin to go one morning, $2 no problem. Repeat a couple of days later, same muffin, $3 that's a problem. There are plenty of other places to get a muffin on the run. I will never go there again.
author: K S.

description:
I visited this morning and I really like this place! 

The staff was so friendly and welcoming to all guests. I had a #1 (breakfast sandwich) on a croissant; woo! Delicious. Coffee was great too. 

Highly recommend.
author: Catherine J.

description:
At work, when I feel like a sandwich or a bagel, I go to Working Girls'! 

There's usually a line during the work hour lunch rush but the lines moves fast and you don't have to wait more than 10 minutes for your food. They've got an efficient system from paying to making sandwiches/salads.

They have a great selection of sandwiches but I usually make my own. For $9, you get a decent sized sandwich. They have the two things I love in a sandwich: pastrami and dutch crunch bread! Their bagels are pretty good too.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Lets cut the BS: friendly staff, fast service, & yummy salads.

I order the chipotle chicken salad w/ avocado no bread.
author: Janno L.

description:
I work just up the street from Working Girls' Cafe and I decided to finally give it a try. When I called to order through the phone to order the Caprese Salad, the guy said "OK, 1 minute!" and I was just like oh wait.. do you guys have salads pre-made..? But when I went back to get the Chipotle Chicken Salad, they did not even tell me how long it was going to take but quickly realized that they of course make it on the spot.

Regardless, I went to go pick up my food and was surprised by the amount of food they gave me! It lasted me for 2 meals and it is definitely worth $10.95! Everything about the salads I tried was good, the workers were super nice and I definitely will come back here and would love to try their breakfast menu also!
author: Thai C.

description:
There is always a line at this place. today was not. so I went in and order one of their top sandwiches, LEMON CHICKEN...surprisingly it was VERY VERY GOOD.
best than the IKE sandwiches I had once.
author: Tak P.

description:
My #1 spot to grab lunch on the go. Their sandwiches and salads are filling and priced right. Lines get long during peak times, but move fairly quickly.
 
My favorite item is the lemon garlic kale & quinoa salad. I usually order this with salmon. Portions are huge and sometimes it's too big to finish for lunch. Order your dressing on the side if you don't want your salad to be drenched in dressing.
author: Helen C.

description:
YUMMY salads!!!! Being on my pretend health kick 24/7 but not losing weight (lol) I am trying new places around work. This is right next door and coworkers were talking about it, so had to give it a look! 

The line was pretty long but moves quickly. They have tons of choices, from bagel sandwiches to salads to soups! I got the caprese salad w added salmon, totaling to about $11. I got a side of chicken noodle as well, which was pretty decent! 

I would definitely suggest if looking for a quick and custom meal. I'll be back, aka today!!!!
author: Mahsa T.

description: Best "Bang for your Buck". Great sandwiches, Friendly service and affordable prices. My pick was a Chicken teriyaki sandwhich with pineapple AAA+++ @$10.95  - there isn't a better buy in town.
author: Russell C.

description: Cute corner cafe serving a variety of breakfast and lunch sandwiches.  Decided to order a salmon and cream cheese bagel.  Good choice.  It was loaded with smoked salmon, cream cheese, onions, tomatoes, and capers on a toasted bagel.  Bagel and small coffee came to $8 which is a steal in any busy downtown area.  There is 5 small tables or 5 spots up at the window where you can sit and watch the hustle and bustle of San Franciscans making their way through the work day.  I like!
author: Kimberly D.

description: Very affordable breakfast spot in San Francisco, near Union Square and Chinatown. I ordered the smoked salmon bagel and my husband got one of the egg breakfast bagel sandwiches and the total was $13! A lot of other local places will be that much for just 1 person. And despite the relative cheap prices, they don't stiff you on quality.
author: Mindi A.

description: I'm done with this place. I've waited in line, gotten to the front, been greeted and then had the cashier turn away to make coffee in the middle of my order. I've stood idly by for minutes after my order was brought to the cashier and was just sitting there out of reach because they don't have a barista to make coffee. I've ordered a salad, had the next customer order the same exact salad with added chicken, seen them get that order immediately and waited around for my own. I've gotten all the way back to work before realizing they gave me the wrong order. I've been served salads mixed with olives and almost broke teeth finding out they weren't pitted. No longer; there are more than enough better choices in the area.
author: Nathan H.

description:
super good! very fresh as well! got the Italian Salami Deli!!! soooooo good 
nice workers! also very neat & clean :)
author: Maitha V.

description:
I stopped by here because their latte art and salads looked amazing on their Yelp page.  They didn't make salads at 7:45am, which was understandable, so I ordered a cappuccino.   Whenever the barista grabs a huge cup for a single shot cappuccino, its a bad sign.  I was hoping that the cup he was making belonged to someone else, but it came right into my hands.  Boo.  I wanted to run with my money, but I paid the guy.  As expected the cappuccino tasted like booboo with over steamed milk.  

As I was walking with my acidic bitter cappuccino, I passed by Coffee Bar and Foundation Café with so much regret.  Damnit... working girls deserves better coffee than this!
author: Lynn L.

description:
Ahhh, I fucking love Working Girls!
I literally found myself here every morning.  I didn't even mean to, it's out of my budget, but I'm still there.

I get the...
The Number 2: A Ham, Egg, Cheese and Tomato (I remove the Tomato) on a croissant.
Americano no Room

I've only been there a few times, and they already remember me!
author: Sierra H.

description: Funny story on how I found this place around Christmas last year! While looking up easy breakfast places while in San Fran I was hurt to see that everywhere was so dark expensive. My boyfriend and I just so happened to put down yelp and go out on a limb and stop at any place we saw. On the way to get food I came across a man who was dancing and having a blast walking down the street. I said "I wish I was going nuts where that man was going" ironically the place we went for breakfast that day (and the rest of our trip) was the same place the happy man worked at. Upon going in the employees were so nice and after a day they started to know our order. The man ended up being from where me and my boyfriend are from which was awesome! If I ever go back to San Fran I am going to stop by here in hopes of seeing that man again! Awesome food for a great price and best service in San Fran! I recommend this place completely!!! Quick and good! I hope everyone who works here is continuously blessed!
author: Elexus P.

description: We ordered salads from Working Girls while we were getting ready for my friends wedding. They wouldn't deliver to our hotel (Stanford Court, which was only ten minutes away), but we sent someone to pick them up, and they were delicious and huge. Definitely a step up from your regular salad place.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
I normally bring food to work for lunch. But if I go out and stay up super late the night before, I end up hitting snooze one too many times and I have to make a run for the bus. This was my situation last Friday. When figuring out what to have for lunch, I decided to finally check out Working Girls' Cafe.

I ended up ordering the Caprese sandwich: fresh mozzarella, tomato, basil, olive oil and balsamic vinegar on a toasted french baguette ($9.25). For some reason, it took a while for them to make this. Even the cashier apologized for it taking so long. Wasn't a big deal to me in the end, but it was nice that he acknowledged how long I had been waiting.

I brought the sandwich back to work to eat in our break room. The bread was warm and toasty. I took a bite of the sandwich and wondered where was the flavor?! The mozzarella, tomato and basil where all cold which provided an odd mix of temperatures in comparison to the bread. I wanted the mozzarella to be warm and gooey. The olive oil and balsamic barely added any flavor. This sandwich was in need of some seasoning, like salt. On the positive note, the mozzarella and tomato tasted nice and fresh. And the sandwich was huge. You're definitely getting your money's worth in terms of size.

My coworker raved about how good her California melt was here, so I was expecting an amazing sandwich. Instead I got a sandwich with good ingredients, but no flavor. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. Who knows. But I won't be back to get their Caprese. Maybe I'll try the California melt instead?
author: Elena N.

description:
For the 2 years I have worked in Financial District, I probably visit this little cafe/lunch-spot at least once a week. It is quick and the food is fresh and tasty. 

My recommendations are: 
- Chipotle Chicken Salad (and sometimes sub the chicken for tuna) 
- Kale Salad (the dressing on this salad is DELICIOUS and so light and citrusy)

Sometimes, I'll get a sandwich and it is good, too. Nothing pops out to mind though because I almost always get one of the above-mentioned salads. 

The price is quite affordable given its competition too. Salad is $11 and it's a very good portion, and depending on hunger level, it can be too big to finish for lunch. The workers are very friendly too so I like supporting these types of businesses in SF.
author: Anna M.

description: Sometimes I hit all the green lights on Kearny and feel like I should treat myself to a delightful everything bagel with cream cheese and sprouts and tomatoes. They have some other breakfast sandwiches that look really tasty. Only the best days start with Working Girls' Cafe, trust me. I still need to swing by during lunch to try out their salads.
author: Natasha P.

description: I really enjoyed visiting Working Girl's Cafe when I was on vacation in San Francisco good food good prices.
author: Tina C.

description: Love this cafe, great sandwiches and service. Highly recommend spicy cajun chicken sandwich.
author: Praniti S.

description:
Working Girls' Cafe would get four stars just for the simple matter of being open on a Sunday afternoon. The Financial District is a (relative) ghost town on the weekend so roaming its streets fresh off an airplane and hangry is not the place to be. Thank goodness for a quick check of the Jelps. WGC, it is. Plus, you know, the name sings to my soul.*

Walking in, I'd skimmed the reviews and prepped myself for a Soup Nazi run-in. I experienced nothing of the sort. Yes, the owner is direct and has his way about him but there's a reason he has a legion of loyal customers. Figure out how the system works, order appropriately, take your food, and go. It's easy. Do it. And, I did.

I opted for the MexiCali without sour cream.** The sandwich was huge, messy, filling, and more delicious than it had the right to be. It's a chicken sandwich, packed with jack cheese, black beans, corn, tomato, lettuce, and Spanish Sauce (admittedly, I had some pause when contemplating said sauce) all on a toasted roll. The flavors work. Sometimes when coming up with a sandwich, it's easy to just put a bunch of stuff on bread and eat it. Not so here. This combination took some thinking and the execution is fantastic. No, the sandwich doesn't come with a side (I got chips with my sandwich) but it's so large that you won't need one. You may *want* one but you won't need one. I am a fatty who eats a lot and by the end of getting through this bad boy, I was panting and my hands, mouth and shirt were covered in Spanish sauce (eyes up here, bub). WGC is popular for a reason. Don't question it; just do it. I may not venture inside its doors on a busy weekday at lunch time but on a cold and lonely Sunday in the Financial District, you better believe I know where I'm headed.

*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cv-0mmVnxPA
** Sour cream is second to mayonnaise in its nastiness and evil.
author: Johnny T.

description: This one is alright, but the one on New Montgomery is better. I usually get the Kale & Quinoa salad (at the other location). Since moving offices, I discovered this location close by. Meh, a little disappointed. They only fill the container 2/3 as much as at the New Montgomery location, and that is important to me (I generally don't like hungry foraging mid-afternoon). $12 for a partially-filled salad is a rip-off in my book
author: Jesse M.

description:
This place is quite expensive but have tasty salad. 
I really like their Mandarin salad. This is located in the financial district in which gets super busy.. Long line for healthy freaks lol 11-1pm usually their busiest hours.

Besides salads, they also have wraps, chips, and selection of drinks. Nice employees and have several seats available for those who would like to eat there. 

Overall, I will come here again whenever I crave for expensive salad that gives a lot of veggies.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
One of the many places advertised to be open on the weekends, but it wasn't.  Advertised hours said it should have opened at 7, we arrived at 7:45 and doors were locked.  
To the owners of this establishment:. If you advertise you open at 7:00, open at 7:00, otherwise change your hours.
author: Nancy P.

description: Meh.  Actually NOPE.  I edited this to read HELL NO. Run AWAY.  $12+ for a sandwich and chips?  And FYI when you advertise something that is called "almond chicken salad" it should actually taste like chicken at some point.  And maybe use a little red onion instead of way too much of it, that would have been OK, but seriously they put so much onion in their chicken salad that it was mostly inedible.  I even tried picking out the onions, but they chopped them up so tiny, that I suspect they used a food processor and created an onion mash when mixing the salad up.  And what's up with filling up most of the sandwich with mixed greens?  I had to pick off all the greens too, hoping to find some chicken buried underneath.  Where's the freaking chicken in this salad? And where are the almonds?  Seriously, I have had way better sandwiches for much less money, I am not going back.  EVER.
author: Barbra K.

description:
Ordered Cali Melt sandwich.  Taste was fine, bread was toasted nicely.  However, the meat and cheese stopped 1/2 way in.  
Meat and cheese in middle of sandwich, cut in half - right through thickest part of meat and cheese to make it look like a full sandwich.  Sandwich wrapped up so you don't see that the back-end of both halves are empty.
#scamsandwich
author: Vic P.

description: These guys are great. Good quality food. Generous portions. Reasonable prices. Friendly quick service.
author: B J.

description:
This is one of those places that should send Yelp a Christmas Card every year. 

As others have written before me, this is a place that I have walked by dozens of times and never once really considered going inside. Just doesn't look all that great, frankly. However, one day I found myself walking down Montgomery on a Saturday morning and in need of a true breakfast, as I knew a Starbucks pastry just wouldn't cut it since I'd just come from the gym. 

Well times like these are where the "Open Now" feature on Yelp was invited, because I know that 90% of the restaurants on Montgomery/Kearny are only open during business hours on weekdays.

So to Yelp we went - and that's how we came to find a little establishment called the "Working Girls" Cafe. I say "Working Girls" in quotes because when I walked in there were two large, male construction workers, myself, and two men working behind the counter. So the title may be a bit of a misnomer, but that really doesn't matter much to me. I come for the food. 

And although I came in with low expectations, I left the place full satisfied. The #2 - ham, egg and cheese - substituted with a croissant (!) instead of the bagel is fire. Not talking about Il Canto breakfast burrito status, but it got the job done for a hungry man in need. 

Bonus points for being the only place not named "Starbucks" in the area that's actually open on the weekend.
author: Brian S.

description: First time ordering from the place. Actually only picked this place because of the way it smelled when walking to another place close to it. Since there was a group of us that I was picking up for I had to make a cal and get the order and they guy was very patient. The subs came out very fast. Never heard of this place before today but glad I did because they were one of the best sandwich places I've had. The place was small and packed but understandable when you're a good place. With great service. Not much else to say but the pictures did just themselves.
author: Jevell R.

description: Substitute croissant for bagels on your breakfast sandwich! Winner, baby! The price is right & delish to boot!
author: Maureen P.

description:
I seriously love this place. Everything there is tasty - have had their salads, sandwiches, and bagels!!! The only reason why I give it 4 stars is because their soups are only okay...sort of bland and lacks depth. In addition,, one time i asked for a tomato, cheddar bagel and they just put cheddar in it! Didnt oopen it up to eat it until I got back to the office :(

Try their chipotle chicken salad, lemon kale, and california melt!!!
author: Annie K.

description:
Prosciutto sandwich: yummy combo of prosciutto and basil!
Got it with a side of mixed greens salad, and ended up saving the second half of my lunch for later. Huge chunk of prosciutto can get a bit too salty, but super filling and yummy.
author: Heyun J.

description:
Work it girls!! At least these girls can....or at least the girls and guys making the food : )

I stumbled upon this place on somewhat accident, after coming back from picking up my capsules at the nearby Nespresso boutique. I was in route back to bart, as well as in hopes to find an inexpensive place to eat for lunch. That's when I noticed this cafe.

Interior and exterior is nothing appealing, for the place just exudes your average, no frill cafeteria- like cafe. Don't let it fool you though, these girls know how to work it; and I also got the sense they must be doing something right based upon the long line of patrons eagerly waiting to get their grub on. 

They have a really appealing sandwich selection to choose from, as well as a nice selection of salads along with other treats. I was in a carb watching kind of mood, so after eyeing the Cobb Salad they offered, my ultimate decision was quick to come to. I got the Cobb, requesting no blue cheese, and instead of the vinaigrette they offer, I requested their spicy ranch on the side. Total $9.75.

Salad was made in less than 10 min and was put in plastic container to go. I ended up sitting at the bar table by the window. 

Now for the salad, AWESOME!! Not only was the presentation captivatingly appealing, it all turned out to be mouthwatering delicious! All the components that made up the salad were fresh and absolutely delectable: fresh crispy bacon, vibrantly colorful, juicy tomatoes; perfectly ripen slices of avocado and quality tasting deli style turkey! Oh and the spicy ranch dressing? Sensationally creamy with a really nice spicy kick! Married the salad beautifully! Muah! Who would a thought this place would execute such a fantastically fresh, tasty salad? Sold!

If I worked close by, this place would certainly be my staple food spot.Continue to work it girls! I'll be back : )
author: Shannon H.

description:
Sandwiches and salads for the working girls in Financial District!

They offer a good amount of selections in their sandwiches and salads!

Their Prosciutto Sandwich with mozzarella cheese, layers of prosciutto and basil was decent.  Their Chicken Parmesan with melted, warm cheese and saucy chicken meat fared better. 

Their salads were freshly tossed.  Their Caesar Salad delivered that Caesar dressing flavor that I prefer pretty well.  

I like their bottled lemonade and peach juice beverages.  It compliments the sandwiches and salads.

What a great name to the cafe to promote and give pride to the working girls in the Financial District and beyond!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
So many delicious-sounding options to choose from! Breakfast bagels, sandwiches, and salads... there is something for every time of day. Actually, I was pretty overwhelmed with all the options, but it's great that all the sandwiches are the same price ($8.95) unless you want to add soup or salad. 

I was a bit confused walking in because there was a man walking around and cleaning the store but no one standing at the cash register, so I wasn't sure how to order. He asked me what I wanted and gave my order to the lady making sandwiches behind the counter. It was a little offputting but hey, it makes you feel like you're part of the family.

I ordered the Fire Roasted Pork Sandwich, which has BBQ Sauce, Provolone Cheese, Capers, Lettuce, Tomato, Mayo, and Red Onions on a Toasted Soft Roll. Delicious! Love how many ingredients they include in all their sandwiches, along with the bread that goes best with those ingredients. 

I would come here again because of how close it is to my workplace. Great place to grab some lunch to-go! Plus they are open until 6PM on weekdays, which is longer than many lunch places in FiDi so extra snaps for that.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Came here twice for lunch while at a conference last week. First time I had the pesto chicken, second time I had the cobb salad. The pesto chicken + eggplant was amazing and I ate half for lunch and the other half for breakfast the next day. Portions are generous!

There was a line out the door one day but they move very quickly.

Reasonably priced and friendly cashiers. Limited seating.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Great customer service.  Been here maybe 20 times.  It is mediocre.  The sandwiches and salads are not bad, but they aren't great.  Lou's is vastly better.  If you need a quick bite and you are in the area it is good, they are fast and efficient, but they simply don't produce a product that tastes that good. 

The salads are too big and not healthy at all.  Not sure why someone would buy a salad if they aren't trying to be healthy.  These salads are probably 1,500 calories or so.
author: Tree P.

description: I had a sandwich and a salad, both tasted great. This place is very busy but they keep the orders moving.  I only had to wait a few minutes.  Would come back here again.
author: Brian B.

description: I had the peppered red snapper which was really good! A bit on the messy side but a couple of napkins fixes that issue, It's a little on the spicy side for the faint of heart but for avid spicy eaters it's about average.. I've also had their salads the Cobb is my favorite.. the staff is very friendly and its pretty clean inside.
author: Miguel C.

description: Solid lunch spot- this is my go-to when I need a salad or sandwich. They've got a pretty good selection and the portions are decent. Can be a bit of a wait around lunch time, but I always come back
author: Sara F.

description: Great place for lunch. I love their salads, especially the Mandarin Chicken Salad and Kale Salad.
author: Lily P.

description:
Noticed that the kale salad was quite popular so I had it, but it was not that good. I say that as a Kale-lover. The name of the salad was misleading because it was something protein, which I automatically assumed had some sort of meat - but it was pure kale. The dressing did not feel that healthy and the little piece of bread was a little piece o' bloop. 

Kale on kale on kale. KALE NO!
author: Juliana P.

description: Simple sandwiches at reasonable prices. It is worth a quick stop if you need a fast meal on the go.
author: Brian G.

description:
Despite the other reviews, I am not a fan of Working Girls' Cafe. This was my first time going there based on "trying something new". I searched on Yelp for the recommendation. 

The cafe has a drab looking exterior that could be spruced up with some simple changes. Even a few inexpensive changes, such as a new overhead signage could give the restaurant an older but taken care of ambiance. The fluorescent ceiling lighting in the restaurant could also be updated. Everything appeared to be dated. 

When I arrived inside the restaurant, I didn't know what type of sandwich to order and started to read the menu. Apparently, looking up at the menu boards for about two minutes isn't okay with the guy behind the counter. While reading the menu, I could see him impatiently staring at me while giving off "hurry up" vibes. Just relax. I'll order when ready. 

When I walked up to the ordering counter, I still had questions about the pesto sauce ingredients for the pesto chicken sandwich (due to allergies). The guy behind the counter didn't seem to pleased with my questions. He answered my questions; but, he gave a sense of "hurry up" to me again. I decided to order the pesto chicken sandwich. I felt slightly uncomfortable in the restaurant.

There wasn't anything special about the pesto chicken sandwich. This sandwich wasn't flavorful. The bread was greasy; and there wasn't much toppings or chicken between the bread. Disappointing and pricey $14.00 experience.
author: Sarita S.

description:
The other day I came in to get a late sandwich (around 3 PM) and my debit card didn't work and the owner said "don't worry about it, I know you're a regular" and wrote my number down on the receipt to call me later (I called them right back with another CC#). He said "you look stressed, go grab yourself a drink on me" (I was totally stressed and a little hangry!). 

Kind gestures like that will make me a loyal customer for life!
author: Mi M.

description: The food here is basic, but reliable. Service is great and always have had good quality food. They're really quick, attentive and friendly. Kale quinoa salad is really great and fresh!
author: Carly M.

description:
I've eaten here a handful of times over the last few years and wondered why their salads seemed to skimp on the ingredients. Turns out it wasn't my imagination. They are. 

If you can't eat or don't want a certain item ( in my case black beans) because everything is pre mixed you lose a whole host of other vegetables like corn, bell peppers, onion). Really lame when you are offer salads and not fair to the customer who is paying a fixed price for everything but only getting partial veggies. 

I understand shortcuts, but I've never been told and it isn't at all explained on their menu. As I've said lame.
author: Amy Z.

description: The kale salad is a public service. If I could eat that kale salad everyday, I would be so happy and healthy and svelte.  Go get it
author: Maureen D.

description: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in the FiDi.  My go to is a simple egg and cheese on a croissant.  Delicious, fast, and super friendly staff.  I need to go back during lunch and try their sandwiches; they look delicious!
author: Farah E.

description:
I've visited this location twice.  If I was rating the place on my first visit, they would gave gotten 3-4 stars.  My visit today was a 1 star experience.

My first visit I ordered a chai tea latte & an almond croissant.  Everything was good as far as the service I received from the girl who took my order and the food & beverage I received.  It's FREEZING out and they leave the doors open, all the time, which I'm not a fan of and the interior is old and dingy looking.

I went for lunch today and the entire experience was awful and I will never go back for lunch food, not sure I'd go back at all after my experience today.

Today I wanted to treat myself and get a BLT.  All of it was awful, from the thin, soggy sourdough bread, to the wet lettuce, to the supper fatty, limp soggy microwaved bacon.  The service from the taller guy with the buzz cut was terrible as well.  He was somewhat short/rude with me and if I ever do go back, it won't be when he is there.  

I do not recommend this place for lunch, and I might never come back at all.  Sad to say, I'd rather eat a sandwich from Starbucks of all places....
author: Elicia L.

description:
Popeye says that spinach will make you stronger.

I don't know if that's propaganda or just him having an addiction to a leafy vegetable.

Either way, the only way I'll eat a spinach salad is if it's prepared at Working Girl's.

The dressing, toasted nuts, and dressing are so good.

I once ate here every day for two weeks until my spinach salad craving went away.

I haven't tried anything else here.

Don't need to--since all I want is their spinach salad.
author: Jack R.

description:
Hate to bring down the average here, but I was sorely unimpressed...

Landed here when on the hunt for a healthy yet satisfying Monday night dinner. Opted for the Chinese chicken salad, which was mainly limp lettuce and overcooked chicken. Wasn't a fan of the dressing either. The rest of the veg was pretty sad looking, too.

I was disappointed to not see the beet salad on this location's menu. I'm sure this place impresses in other regards, but it didn't do it for me. Service was friendly and quick, but I was disappointed in the quality and taste.
author: Brianna M.

description:
All of the sandwiches looked pretty tantalizing, but being on the West coast, I had to have fresh tomatoes, so I went with the Caprese Sandwich. It was a very good choice, with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, lettuce and balsamic vinaigrette. 

I also feel like they didn't skimp on the ingredients. Sometimes I feel like when you go for an all veggie sandwich, it's literally a piece of lettuce. Not so with this bad boy!

The bun was legit too. I'm not a big fan of baguettes, and while it had the texture of a baguette, it was slightly softer and easier to bite into. Very good choice, if I do say so myself!
author: Rachel C.

description: I came here for lunch with coworkers and the place was super busy. It's a decent size location with tables but that place was crowded I wouldn't feel comfortable eating there. My coworkers and I were headed to another location a few doors down at first but when we walked in, it just wasn't a place we were interested in trying. So we decided to go back to Working Girls Cafe because when we had walked by it smelt so good. Despite it being so busy, service was really fast even though we ordered lunch for about ten people. I go the Chipotle Chicken Breast Salad and was so delicious! Worth every dollar for the large portion. Everyone in the office was satisfied with what they got.
author: Valerie N.

description: Spectacular breakfast! Had #2 with ham on croissant really hit the spot. Also had salmon cream cheese bagel also good but the #2 hit the spot because it was warm. The lattes were delicious as well made for coffee lovers with strong coffee taste not overly milky
author: Bethany S.

description:
Excellent tasting sandwitches.  I've had the Salmon sandwitch and the Bruscetta sandwitch, both of which tasted excellent.  the ingredients tasted fresh and flavorful.  The bread is toasted exactly right with just a hint of flavored oil added.  the sandwitches are made just in time, in real time, unlike the place across the street.

But, it is expensive - 10$ !
author: Pascal A.

description:
This little cafe on the corner in the depths of FiDi is perfect to grab some lunch during the workday. They're quick and friendly! 

The staff here is super nice. One customer was paying with mastercard, which they don't accept, and she worked across the street so he just gave her the chance to pay him back the next time. I love places like these because they build loyalty with their customers.

They were also really nice about substitutions, if you wanted your sandwich exactly your way, they'll do anything to make it so for you. 

I got the chicken breast pesto sandwich which was perfectly panini'd (yes that's a word) on foccacia bread. It was delicious and the cheese was perfectly melty. There wasn't much of a sundried tomato taste, even though it was listed on the menu, but the pesto was so delicious I didn't complain. The salads are pretty big portions and I've been told the chicken caesar is amazing.
author: Erika M.

description:
Thank you, Working Girls', for being the shining light in the world of darkness that is Bush and Kearny - Overrun by FiDi's most ruthless worker bees. I used to visit only when Starbucks had a line out the door.. Now it's become a daily routine. 

Your bacon, tomato and avocado on an onion bagel hits the spot perfectly every morning. And paired with your large iced coffee.. It's heaven. 

Staff is so friendly, especially the younger girl working the cashier every morning - she's a doll.
author: Alex G.

description: My husband and I loved our sandwiches, but I wouldn't suggest the Caesar salad, and call me snobbish but gumbo outside of Louisiana just isn't the same. If you know what they do best though, you can't go wrong!
author: Adria T.

description:
They made me a cheese and apple sandwich even though it wasn't on the menu. 

The sandwich maker kind of laughed at me the whole time as if it was the most absurd thing they had ever heard of but they did it ;)
author: C D.

description: The blackened snapper sandwich might be the best sandwich I've ever had. And the service is fantastic. It's my most favorite place to go for lunch. Bravo Working Girls.
author: Jules P.

description: I've only been once and had a Cobb salad (swapped the ham for chicken) and it was so tasty. Big portions too! A lot of places in the financial district in SF seem to be closed on the weekend for lunch so it was nice to find a great place open!
author: Lauren L.

description: I came here for lunch for the first time after reading the previous yelp reviews and really enjoyed it. They have a bunch of sandwiches and salads to choose from and it's all fresh and healthy. I got the kale and quinoa salad which was delicious. I'm excited to go back to try more things!
author: Harmony H.

description: This place is nothing special but it's good for grab-n-go kind of food. My friend ordered the #1 bagel and I ordered the #2 bagel along with a coffee. The place had a decent amount of tables and the food came out quickly. Overall the bagel was basic containing egg, cheese and bacon. It definitely hit the spot and I wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Casey B.

description:
I've been coming here regularly on the weekend for over two years and when it comes to a café with a lot of variety, great atmosphere and delicious food...this place is it! I've never had a meal there I did not enjoy and I've ate many of the sandwiches (including the breakfast sandwiches), soups and salads. 

A personal favorite is the chipotle chicken salad with kale substituted in for the lettuce. Also, Working Girls has a wide selection of hot and cold beverages from basic drip coffee to espresso to sodas and iced teas. I'll take a cappuccino from here any day over the nearby competition.

As for quality of service, I'd sum it up in one word, Great! The staff makes an effort to not only get to know you, but also be efficient with getting through everyone's order.
author: Max F.

description: I went here this afternoon. The server behind the counter was very uninterested to begin with, seeing him on his phone the whole time not really excited to help us. After ordering a spinach salad and a bagel, I found BLACK HAIR under my bagel. After telling the guy that I was very unsatisfied, he just turned to me with "uhh.. you want another one..". Not apologising or showing sympathy whatsoever. Worst service, bad food. Wouldn't recommend going here.
author: Caitlyn B.

description:
I looked up "best Caesar salad" in this area and it gave me this location! I work nearby so I do searches like this all the time and they rarely disappoint!

This is one of the best salads I've eaten! But I do modify everything after the first times I try things. I add light feta cheese and no onions. This salad is huge! I never finish it. 

I tried the chipotle chicken salad yesterday and it is life itself. I just took off the onions but OMG! So good. The chips are perfect in it! Will continue to go!

After all this time, finally tried the sandwiches. The chipotle Cajun sandwich is one of the best things I've ever ate!
author: Ruby S.

description:
I'll give this place a solid 4 stars. The place is usually crowded which I consider a good sign, good stuff draws people, nasty food=usually empty. 

I got the chicken Parm and added a side salad for $3 so it was a bit over $12 total. Over all it was pretty good, I liked the salad more than the sandwich. The salad definitely was more than I expected in a mixed greens side salad, it had candied walnuts, Gorgonzola, & apples...while most side salads are just blah. The sandwich was pretty good, but not amazing, but the menu is pretty expansive I'll definitely be back. I feel like maybe the salads here are the star of the restaurant. Oh yea and the staff were super friendly and helpful.
author: Imani T.

description:
I've just recently learned that Working Girls' Cafe offers a kale and quinoa salad (for some reason it's not listed on their main menu).

My co-workers ordered it the other day and it looked incredible. It was full of kale and had a nice heaping of quinoa and other vegetables intermingled amongst the green.

I stuck with my standard greek salad, but I'm definitely looking forward to returning to Working Girls' for a dose of their lovely charm and their new healthy kale dish.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
My friend and I were pretty hungry after taking a class downtown so we walked over to this place. We were looking for a new place to try and the name kind of made us curious.

The place is small and the workers are fairly friendly. I decided to order the Spicy Thai Chicken sandwich and I think my friend got the California BLT or something. He forgot. He also ordered a chai tea for himself.

The chai tea was pretty good. Nothing spectacular but not bad. I'd say it was more on the good side than bad but my friend didn't like it. He said it was a little too sweet for him.

We didn't eat our sandwiches until much later. We split our sandwiches so we got to try both. 

The Spicy Thai Chicken was good, but I expected more from the spicy peanut sauce they used. It didn't really taste like peanuts so it was more of a slightly sweet spicy chicken sandwich. I did not like the red onions in the sandwich at all. My friend agrees with me.

My friend's BLT type sandwich was good, but more on the average side. The avocados they used were okay, not the best. I honestly don't remember much about this sandwich.

Overall, okay place. Good for a quick lunch.
author: Sofia R.

description: Just wanted 5 bagels before we all got on the road. Easy enough, but . . . at 0710, as I'm waiting on my bagel order, a delivery guy is bringing in bags of fresh baked breads. Pretty sure I was served yesterday's bagels. Asked for 2 toasted bagels; maybe the setting was "ultra light toast", because I could sense no heat application to the bagel minutes later as I bit into my day-old. Lastly, 3 of the bagels were not toasted, and reserved for later consumption. I asked for cream cheese for these 3 disks of dough, and when I asked, "Did you put cream cheese in the bag?", I got a look like, "Ummm?". Bag goes back to food prep area, and upon return, a cheerful, "Here you go!"  10 minutes later, and we discover one specimen cup of cream cheese . . . for 3 bay-gels . . . we probably didn't need the extra calories, but the gang was a tad disappointed they had to share the smear . . . I just wanted 5 bagels for the road . . .
author: Rich S.

description:
Such a bad experience. I admit I should be happy finding something open on Sunday in the Financial District, but I think I was more unlucky to find this joint. I got a parmesan  sandwich to go. While I am waiting I saw my chicken on a plate with cheese and sauce go into the microwave. Shame on you guys, microwaves are for popcorn! So there is one girl running the microwave and one guy 'working' the cash register only concerned with the girls who walk by and come in. He's looking at photos on one customers iPhone of her 2 Fast 2 Furious car when she says, ' Can we order my food, I only have 15mins.'. Money well spent on that guys wages. If he put that much energy in helping out in there they could have time to heat their food properly. Needless to say the sandwich was forgettable at best. The chicken tasted once frozen, sauce was out of can. No flavor. This is just one item, yes, but the practices I saw in there leads me to believe everything else follows. 

No return for me.
author: Tim N.

description:
I try to eat salads at lunch, if I can help it.  No carbo-loading at lunch--makes the 3:00 p.m. caffeine crash that much worse.  

I've walked by this cafe repeatedly, and thought I would swing by to try it a couple of Fridays ago.  I came around 1:00 p.m. in hopes of beating the lunch rush.  Fail.  

I always take my lunch to-go, as I do not usually have time to eat in-house.  WGC was pretty full, even after prime lunch hours--there was barely any space for me to wait for my salad.  The salad took about 15-20 minutes.  It's not the longest I've ever waited, it just wasn't a comfortable wait--there a lot of other people waiting with you.  I think my order got lost in the shuffle, as after about 10 minutes they asked me what I was waiting for.   

I ordered a Cobb salad--which was A-OK.  It was dressed appropriately (not too much, not too little), and that deserves an award in and of itself.  

Like everywhere else in the financial district, salads are a little pricy at WGC.  But I have come to expect this.  Does anyone know where you can get a decent salad under $10?  I sure don't.  

Maybe I'll try it before noon next time.  Not bad!
author: Sunny S.

description: I've had pesto chicken breast sandwich. It was delicious. The cashier was friendly.  One of the best sandwiches in SF.
author: Ibo K.

description:
I was on a business trip for two weeks in San Francisco, and the Working Girls' Cafe was on my walk to Moscone Center.  It looked like a pleasant place, so I decided to try it for a quick breakfast one morning.  What ended up happening was I kept coming back almost every morning!  Delicious coffee, and if I wasn't in too big of a hurry, I'd try a different breakfast sandwich.  Tasty and filling every time!

Probably the best part was that the staff began to recognize me, and a small coffee was always poured for me as soon as I walked in, without me even needing to ask.  From the cooks and prep staff to the cashiers, they were all hard workers.  On my last day, I was sent off with well wishes.  Much appreciated that they treated a short-term customer with such respect!
author: Kristin C.

description: Love this place !!!  Great service and great food at low prices !  I love how friendly all the staff was when I needed help picking a sandwich by giving my suggestions and opinions. I had the blacked red snapper special sandwich and chai latte which was so yummy. I added black beans but was told it was already mixed in with corn yet they were nice enough to pick out the corn for me. So nice of them ! Definitely recommend!
author: Evelyn G.

description: I ordered the lox combo on the cheese bagel.. absolutely delicious! I would recommend it. Will have to try this place again. A lot of people seem to get salads, so I might have to try one of those.
author: Joievee B.

description: The salads are great here, but I am not a fan of the sandwiches. The quantity of food is really good. Maybe I ordered the wrong kind of sandwich so I wasn't impressed, but I love the chipotle chicken salad here, and the Cobb salad. I always order over the phone, and when I pick up, i don't need to stand in line, so that really saves time.
author: Seerat S.

description: Great spot to get a quick sandwich or salad takeout during lunch. I came for the baby spinach salad and the portion size was so generous I could have eaten it for three meals. Recommended! (:
author: Christina N.

description:
Service was fast here and they are pretty friendly. Limited seats available but they are generally always empty as people come here for take out or for a quick meal. Salad portions here were pretty generous! 

Add on salmon and no regrets!
author: Yilin T.

description: Stopped in here on vacation for a quick, healthy afternoon bite. We had the Green Salad and the soup of the day. Both items were so fresh and delicious! The $9 salad was a huge portion with all fresh ingredients. My mom had the soup and said it was great and not too salty. If we have time to come back during our trip, we definitely will!
author: Christine L.

description:
Possibly the best sandwich in the world...ever.

I like the grilled snapper, the Calfornia melt, the Mexicali, and the BBQ chicken sandwiches.
author: Wes F.

description: Super friendly staff, delicious and fresh salads! Perfect place to grab a quick, healthy lunch.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I often come here for lunch as I work just off Montgomery Street,  1 Block away. 
  Working Girl has a very extensive menu. I find myself always going back to the chicken pesto sandwich.  It's delicious.  Chicken breast in pesto with sundried Tomatoes,  provolone cheese on Toasted Foccacia.  
  It has many different sandwiches,  salads and also has breakfast items.  I haven't been for Breakfast as of yet. I plan on it though.  I have ordered the Ceasar Salad and I'll say you get a nice size portion. 
  The shop is small, there is often a line out the door but it moves rather quickly.  There is some counter spaces to eat along with about 6 small tables in the back.  Most order there food to go. 
   I'd recommend a stop at Working Girl for lunch anytime.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I love this place! I always go here when I'm in the mood for a salad. I usually get the Mandarin Salad or Caesar Salad with grilled chicken. Both are delicious. 

I docked one star because of the size of the place. It can get pretty crowded during the lunch time rush.
author: Gail M.

description: Delicious and fast! Perfect to start the day out for a quick grab before seeing the city. Was able to sit at the countertop bar area and look out at the hustle and bustle of city life. Good breakfast sandwich options!
author: Christy B.

description: Great for lunch and decent prices. Sandwhiches are great and salads are delish! Service is quick
author: Krystal C.

description:
Looking for a place to find a salad on a Sunday afternoon we happen across Working Girls'. We were actually on our way to another place, but we saw their sign outside on the sidewalk with a list of their salads & they sounded pretty good. Plus there was a line inside so we figured that should be a good sign as well.

The guy who took our order was very friendly. We ordered the Mixed Green salad - sans cheese & apples, but added chicken. Also, the Caprese salad - sans mozzarella, but added salmon. As we waited, we continued to look at the reviews of this place on yelp. A couple of reviewers said they found cockroaches in their salads. Of course, we were like "UH OH... Is it too late to cancel our orders?" But we braved on. Our orders came up. The first thumbs up I have to give them is the fact that the chicken & the salmon on both salads came out to us piping HOT!!! So with the idea that there might be some extra "protein" in our salads, we actually ate them fairly slow & scrutinized every bite. In the end, we finished our salads without any problems. And I have to say they were delicious! The only thing was eating our food slowly & cautiously hoping to NOT find a cockroach... Again, no cockroaches here for us!

Mixed green salad - sans cheese & apples: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/working-girls-cafe-san-francisco?select=26ywgJXn88tMf0zId3DW7A#26ywgJXn88tMf0zId3DW7A
author: Joel R.

description: Found a large bug at the bottom of my Greek salad. Disappointed and really grossed out.
author: Lee K.

description: Great cafe in San Francisco's financial district.  Great prices and great food!  Definitely worth visiting.  Serves breakfast all day !   Great alternative to fast food !
author: Meredith L.

description: Delicious sandwiches and very helpful counter staff. The Eggplant on Rosemary roll was very good and fresh tasting. Good location and easy to get to from the Union Square area. Wish this business well and they are clearly working hard on their product and service. I would come here for an affordable and really great sandwich anytime.
author: Joel H.

description: Went in yesterday for the Pesto Chicken sandwich. It was not what i was hoping for. Way too much pesto and just an average sandwich.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Great food, reasonable prices and friendly stuff. Breakfast bagel with salmon is the best.
author: Renats S.

description: Breakfast was ok, the Deli Sandwhich was fine but more like an expansive Sub. The bagel with egg and bacon tasted quite blend.. The granola with yoghurt was awesome though.
author: Vincens V.

description: In town for a few days and this place was near our SF office, so went there for lunch.  I can see why it gets the high yelp ratings - a convenient one-price menu and their speed.  The food itself is three stars (A-OK).  Liked it enough I went there for breakfast the next morning - fast, good food.  (For some reason, the napkins from their dispenser smelled like ash tray.)
author: Clayton L.

description:
Let me share with you my TRAUMATIZING experience at Working girls:
Today, I ordered a beat n goat cheese salad, ate 3/4 of it to then find the biggest DEAD ROACH in it!!!!!! I have never in my life been so disgusted of what I had just ate. 
The best part of the story is that when I brought it up and showed it to the manager/owner he said: "I'm sorry these things happen"!!?? If you have an appreciation for dead or living roaches in your food then I would definitely suggest you eat their salads.  If like me, the view of it makes you instantly puke, DEFINITELY DON'T EAT THERE!  #worstfoodexperienceofmylife
author: Sarah S.

description: The best breakfast in San Fran. We loved it so much we went back multiple times during our vacation. Incredible breakfast sandwiches, quick service, DELICIOUS muffins. Not expensive either, especially considering the in the heart of the FiDi.
author: Anna S.

description:
Love this place. I come to st frequently when I'm In sf. Family owned and operated. Always fast, NEVER disappointed when I frequent this place. Menu is so good, tons of variety. The coffee is way better than SB across the street. They always talk to you with respect and do there best to rush your order, because they know people have places to be. 
Ten stars if I could.
author: Hannah K.

description: There are some financial district staples and this happens to be one of them. Huge salads with great combinations that easily satisfied my friend and I! Definitely would come here more often if I worked nearby.
author: Megan W.

description: First time visiting here, and they got my orders wrong. I asked for no onions, and when i bit into the sandwich, guess what?  Onions!!! I know, what's the big deal you say? Onions are delicious! I wish i can enjoy it like the next person, but its the onoin juice that gets me violently ill in my tummy, so i avoid it like a plague. It just irks me to come home anticipating a well executed sandwich since Working Girl was highly recommended, and I  paid good money for 2 sandwiches made incorrectly. Having paid for parking in the garage and $10 per sandwich, I was left very disappointed. Will not try again.
author: Evelyn J.

description: Decent old-school downtown sandwich joint. No frills, but friendly. Does not take Discover. Popular, but efficient. Are there better? Yes, but this is great for its niche.
author: Jesse A.

description:
Great sandwiches and salads! Love this place as it is very consistent, fast and affordable. 

Highly recommend this spot to anyone who works in the area and needs something healthy/fast for lunch, my go-to is the Chinese Salad (I sub Avocado for Chicken).
author: Lauren K.

description: After leaving my breakfast at home this morning, I started to Yelp nearby breakfast places and working girls cafe came up. Looked at the menu and a bagel sounded super satisfying for my hungry craving! I ordered the salmon bagel which was filled with a good amount. Since it's only a two minute walk from the office, I'll definitely be back to try the other food.
author: Steph C.

description:
Let me just say this is the best place to get a Sandwich!!

Came once and that's all it took for me to come back! I've had a few of their sandwiches and the ones that I recommend are the Spicy Cajun Chicken and the Spicy Thai Chicken Sandwich. The Cajun Sandwich I'd say is medium spicy and the thai is not spicy at all... 

I completely love this place!

sandwiches ranges from $7.50-$9.00 depending if you add cheese or other sides.
author: Maribel G.

description: Good breakfast or lunch spot if you're on the go. Friendly staff, fast service, solid food. I'm a sucker for their breakfast sandwiches (went every workday or even twice a day for almost two months) and iced coffee (just ok). For lunch, I recommend their Chinese chicken salad
author: Catherine H.

description: Stopped here on our way out of SF. Fast service, friendly and priced right. Breakfast sandwich was really good. The only reason not 5 stars is because I think that the eggs are pre-made, they are not prepared on a grill in front of you so it doesn't taste super fresh.
author: Melanie M.

description: Great sandwiches (I'm not usually a fan of sandwiches since I find them very dry) - the roasted pork sandwich was flavorful and pretty juicy, and the bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. I also really like their Chinese chicken salad (not a fan of the raw mushrooms inside, but the dressing is amazing and the wontons, peanuts and bell peppers add a nice crunch). And portion size for the salad is huge! Worth your money.
author: Michelle X.

description: Stumbled on this place after another high rated spot was closed. This place is fabulous! Price is so reasonable, staff was great and most of all food is fresh and delicious! This is on my list of go to's when traveling for work from here on out!
author: Audrey R.

description:
Can't go wrong with these sandwiches and salads. My go-to salad is the Chipotle salad which is a bit spicy, sour cream, and tortilla chips. It is a big portion for $10. I also like the variety of sandwiches they offer. I try to get a different one every time I order lunch from here. I like all the chicken sandwiches and the California dream (turkey avocado cheese). The eggplant sandwich is a favorite amongst the vegetarians in my group. The service is friendly and fast. The lines get really long so go before 12 noon or call ahead to place your order.

The prices have gone up and I can't afford to eat here as often but you can't wrong with anything you order here.
author: Candace F.

description:
Working Girl Cafe is super close to my office so I stop by here for lunch sometimes. I usually get the Greek salad. It comes with tomato, cucumber, red onion, pepperoncini, kalamata olives, feta cheese, olive oil, lemon juice, and a little bit of mint. It really good if you are looking for a light lunch. 

I have also had their bbq beef sandwich which comes with roasted beef, pepper jack, BBQ sauce, lettuce, tomato, mayo, red onion on a toasted French roll. It is delicious, I do not order this as often as it is a heavier menu choice than the Greek salad. 

There is usually a little bit of a wait for this place at lunch time, but it is worth it.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Great food, good prices and very friendly staff.
#1 caprese salad w/ chicken
#2 Italian sub sandwich
#3 chipolte chicken salad
author: Brian C.

description:
I stopped by this cafe because I was super hungry and needed something to satisfy my hunger.  For this purpose, the cafe was excellent. As for a place that I would actively seek out and take my friends to? Probably not. 

I had a Cobb salad and it was a pretty large portion and ingredients were fresh. The taste of the salad was okay, but nothing special. Perhaps their sandwiches are better? I'll update the review once I try them.
author: Lillian C.
